title: Provides that bicycle operators and the businesses affiliated with such operators shall be liable for such operator's violation of the law regarding use of a bicycle
summary: Provides that bicycle operators and the businesses affiliated with such operators shall be liable for such operator's failure to carry an identification card or certain other violations regarding the use of a bicycle for commercial purposes; changes violations for the failure to carry an identification card or certain other violation procedures and fines by a commercial bicycle operator; directs that certain violations relating to bicycles used for commercial purposes shall be tried before the environmental control board of the city of New York.

       AN  ACT  to  amend  the  administrative code of the city of New York, in
         relation to the use of bicycles for commercial purposes

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  Section  10-157 of the administrative code of the city of
    2  New York, subdivisions e and f as added and  subdivisions  g  and  h  as
    3  amended by local law number 9 of the city of New York for the year 2007,
    4  is amended to read as follows:
    5    S 10-157 Bicycles used for commercial purposes. a. Every person, firm,
    6  partnership,  joint venture, association or corporation which engages in
    7  the course of its business, either on behalf of  itself  or  others,  in
    8  delivering  packages, parcels, papers or articles of any type by bicycle
    9  shall provide identification of the business by requiring every  bicycle
   10  or bicycle operator to be identified by:
   11    (1)  affixing  to the rear of each bicycle, bicycle seat or both sides
   12  of the delivery basket, a  metal,  plastic  or  other  sign  of  a  type
   13  approved by the police commissioner, with the name of the business and a
   14  three  digit identification number which identifies the bicycle operator
   15  in lettering and numerals so as to be plainly readable at a distance  of
   16  not  less  than ten feet and maintaining same in good condition thereon;
   17  and
   18    (2) by requiring each bicycle operator to  wear  a  jacket,  vest,  or
   19  other  wearing  apparel  on  the  upper part of the cyclist's body while
   20  making deliveries, or otherwise riding a bicycle on behalf of the  busi-
   21  ness, the back of which shall indicate the business name and the bicycle
   22  operator's individual identification number in lettering and numerals so
   23  as to be plainly readable at a distance of not less than ten feet.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.

    1    b.  Every  person,  firm,  partnership,  joint venture, association or
    2  corporation OR SIMILAR ENTITY engaged in providing OR ARRANGING FOR  THE
    3  PROVISION  OF a service as authorized herein must issue to every bicycle
    4  operator a numbered identification card which contains the  name,  resi-
    5  dence  address  and  photo of the bicycle operator and the name, address
    6  and telephone number of the company for whom  the  bicycle  operator  is
    7  [employed]  AFFILIATED.  Such identification card must be carried by the
    8  bicycle operator while the cyclist is making  deliveries,  or  otherwise
    9  riding  a  bicycle  on behalf of the business, and must be produced upon
   10  the demand of a police officer or any other law enforcement officer.
   11    c. Every person, firm, partnership, joint venture,  association  [or],
   12  corporation  OR SIMILAR ENTITY engaged in providing OR ARRANGING FOR THE
   13  PROVISION OF a service as authorized herein shall maintain in a log book
   14  to be kept for such purpose, the name and place of residence address  of
   15  every [employee operating a] bicycle OPERATOR, the date of employment OR
   16  ASSOCIATION  and  discharge  of  each  person in said service, and every
   17  messenger or delivery person's identification number. The owner  of  any
   18  business  engaged  in  providing a service as authorized in this section
   19  shall be responsible for maintaining in the log book a daily trip record
   20  in which all entries shall be made legibly in ink and each  entry  shall
   21  be  dated  and include the bicycle identification number, the operator's
   22  name and the name and place of origin and destination for each trip.  No
   23  entry  shall  be  rewritten  either  in  whole or in part except in such
   24  manner as may be provided by regulation of the  commissioner;  any  such
   25  unauthorized rewriting shall give rise to a rebuttable presumption of an
   26  act  of  fraud, deceit or misrepresentation. Such log book shall be made
   27  available for inspection during regular and usual  business  hours  upon
   28  request  of an agent of the police commissioner or any police officer or
   29  any other person authorized by law.
   30    d. The owner of any business engaged in providing OR ARRANGING FOR THE
   31  PROVISION OF a service as authorized in this section shall file an annu-
   32  al report in such form as shall be designated by the police commissioner
   33  by rule or regulations.   Said report shall  include,  inter  alia,  the
   34  number of bicycles it owns and the number and identity of any [employees
   35  it  may  retain]  BICYCLE  OPERATORS EMPLOYED BY OR OTHERWISE AFFILIATED
   36  WITH SUCH BUSINESS.  Any business engaged in providing  OR  ARRANGING  a
   37  service  as  authorized  in  this  section  shall be responsible for the
   38  compliance with the provisions of this  section  of  any  [employees  it
   39  shall retain] BICYCLE OPERATORS EMPLOYED BY OR OTHERWISE AFFILIATED WITH
   40  SUCH  BUSINESS.  Nothing contained in this section shall be construed as
   41  applying to persons under the age of sixteen who use a bicycle to deliv-
   42  er daily newspapers or circulars.
   43    e. (1) The owner of any business engaged in  providing  a  service  as
   44  authorized in this section shall provide, at its own expense, protective
   45  headgear suitable for each bicycle operator. Such headgear shall:
   46    (i)  meet  the  standards  set  forth  by  the consumer product safety
   47  commission in title 16, part 1203 of the code of federal regulations;
   48    (ii) be readily available at each employment  site  for  use  by  each
   49  bicycle operator; and
   50    (iii)  be  replaced  if  such headgear is no longer in good condition.
   51  Headgear is no longer in good condition if it  is  missing  any  of  its
   52  component parts or is otherwise damaged so as to impair its functionali-
   53  ty.
   54    (2)  Each  bicycle  operator shall wear protective headgear that meets
   55  the requirements of paragraph [1] ONE of this subdivision  while  making
   56  deliveries  or otherwise operating a bicycle on behalf of such business.

       S. 419                              3

    1  The term "wear such  protective  headgear"  means  having  the  headgear
    2  fastened securely upon the head with the headgear straps.
    3    f. The owner of any business engaged in providing a service as author-
    4  ized  in this section, notwithstanding that a bicycle may be provided by
    5  an employee thereof, shall provide at its own expense  and  ensure  that
    6  each  bicycle is equipped with a lamp; a bell or other device capable of
    7  giving an audible signal; brakes; reflective tires  or,  alternately,  a
    8  reflex  reflector  mounted on the spokes of each wheel; as well as other
    9  reflective devices or material, in accordance with  section  [1236]  ONE
   10  THOUSAND TWO HUNDRED THIRTY-SIX of the vehicle and traffic law.
   11    g.  [Except  as  otherwise  provided in subdivision h of this section,
   12  the] THE PERSON, FIRM, PARTNERSHIP, JOINT VENTURE,  ASSOCIATION,  CORPO-
   13  RATION OR OTHER SIMILAR ENTITY ENGAGED IN PROVIDING OR ARRANGING FOR THE
   14  PROVISION OF A SERVICE AS AUTHORIZED IN THIS SECTION SHALL BE LIABLE FOR
   15  ANY  violation  of  any  of  the provisions of [this section,] THIS CODE
   16  REGULATING THE OPERATION OF BICYCLES AND COMMERCIAL BICYCLES or [of] any
   17  [of  the]  rules  or  regulations  that  may  be  promulgated   pursuant
   18  hereto[,].  SUCH VIOLATION shall be [a violation] triable [by a judge of
   19  the  criminal  court]  IN  A PROCEEDING BEFORE THE ENVIRONMENTAL CONTROL
   20  BOARD of the city of New York and upon conviction [thereof] OF A PERSON,
   21  FIRM PARTNERSHIP, JOINT VENTURE, ASSOCIATION, OR  CORPORATION  shall  be
   22  punishable  by a fine of not less than one hundred dollars nor more than
   23  two hundred [and] fifty dollars  [or  imprisonment  for  not  more  than
   24  fifteen  days or both such fine and imprisonment].  IN ADDITION TO OR AS
   25  AN ALTERNATIVE TO THE PENALTIES PROVIDED FOR A VIOLATION OF ANY  OF  THE
   26  PROVISIONS  OF  THIS  SECTION,  OR  OF  ANY  OF THE RULES OR REGULATIONS
   27  PROMULGATED PURSUANT HERETO, ANY  PERSON  WHO  SHALL  VIOLATE  ANY  SUCH
   28  PROVISIONS  SHALL  BE  LIABLE  FOR  A CIVIL PENALTY OF NOT LESS THAN ONE
   29  HUNDRED DOLLARS NOR MORE THAN TWO HUNDRED AND  FIFTY  DOLLARS  FOR  EACH
   30  VIOLATION.  SUCH CIVIL PENALTY MAY BE RECOVERED IN AN ACTION OR PROCEED-
   31  ING IN ANY COURT OF COMPETENT JURISDICTION.
   32    h. [Any person who makes deliveries or otherwise operates a bicycle on
   33  behalf of a business without carrying  the  identification  required  by
   34  subdivision  b  of this section or who fails to produce such identifica-
   35  tion upon demand as required by such subdivision, or who fails  to  wear
   36  protective  headgear required by subdivision e of this section, shall be
   37  guilty of a traffic infraction and  upon  conviction  thereof  shall  be
   38  liable  for  a  fine  of not less than twenty-five dollars nor more than
   39  fifty dollars. It shall  be  an  affirmative  defense  to  such  traffic
   40  infraction  that  the  business  did not provide the protective headgear
   41  required by subdivision e of this section. Such traffic  infraction  may
   42  be adjudicated by such an administrative tribunal as is authorized under
   43  article  two-A  of the vehicle and traffic law.] IN ANY PROSECUTION OF A
   44  PERSON, FIRM, PARTNERSHIP, JOINT VENTURE, ASSOCIATION OR CORPORATION FOR
   45  A VIOLATION OF THIS SECTION, THERE SHALL  BE  A  REBUTTABLE  PRESUMPTION
   46  THAT  SUCH  PERSON,  FIRM,  PARTNERSHIP,  JOINT  VENTURE, ASSOCIATION OR
   47  CORPORATION UTILIZING THE SERVICES OF THE BICYCLE OPERATOR HAD KNOWLEDGE
   48  THAT THE BICYCLE OPERATOR WAS IN VIOLATION OF ANY  SUBDIVISION  OF  THIS
   49  SECTION.
   50    S 2. This act shall take effect on the first of November next succeed-
   51  ing the date on which it shall have become a law.
